rows.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.
I CALL TO witness the dawn
And the Ten Nights,
The multiple and the one,
The night as it advances,

rows.arabic: هَلْ فِى ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٌ لِّذِى حِجْرٍ
rows.translation: Is there not an evidence in this for those who have sense?
rows.transliteration: hal fī dhālika qasamul lidhī ḥijr

rows.arabic: أَلَمْ تَرَ كَيْفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ
rows.translation: Have you not seen what your Lord did to the 'Ad
rows.transliteration: alam tara kayfa fa`ala rabbuka bi`ād

rows.translation: Of Eram with lofty pillars (erected as signposts in the desert),

rows.arabic: ٱلَّتِى لَمْ يُخْلَقْ مِثْلُهَا فِى ٱلْبِلَـٰدِ
rows.translation: The like of whom were never created in the realm;
rows.transliteration: allatī lam yukhlaq mithluhā fil bilād

rows.translation: And with Thamud who carved rocks in the valley;
rows.transliteration: wathamūdal ladhīna jābuṣ ṣakhra bil wād

rows.translation: And the mighty Pharaoh
Who terrorised the region,
And multiplied corruption.
So your Lord poured a scourge of punishment over them.
Your Lord is certainly in wait.

rows.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكْرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَكْرَمَنِ
rows.translation: As for man, whenever his Lord tries him and then is gracious and provides good things for him, he says: "My Lord has been gracious to me."
rows.transliteration: fa-ammal-insānu idhā mab-talāhu rabbuhu fa-akramahu wana``amahu fayaqūlu rabbī akraman

rows.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبْتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيْهِ رِزْقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّىٓ أَهَـٰنَنِ
rows.translation: But when He tries him by restraining his means, he says: "My Lord despises me."
rows.transliteration: wa-ammā idhā mab-talāhu faqadara `alayhi rizqahu fayaqūlu rabbī ahānan

rows.translation: No. In fact you are not generous to the orphans,
Nor do you urge one another to feed the poor,
And you devour (others') inheritance greedily,
And love wealth with all your heart.

rows.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلْأَرْضُ دَكًّا دَكًّا
rows.translation: Surely when We pound the earth to powder grounded, pounded to dust,
And comes your Lord, and angels row on row,
rows.transliteration: wajā-a rabbuka wal malaku ṣaffan ṣaffā

rows.arabic: وَجِا۟ىٓءَ يَوْمَئِذٍۭ بِجَهَنَّمَ ۚ يَوْمَئِذٍ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلْإِنسَـٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكْرَىٰ
rows.translation: And Hell is brought near, that day will man remember, but of what avail will then remembering be?
rows.transliteration: wajī-a yawma-idhin bijahannam ۚ yawma-idhiy yatadhakkarul-insānu wa-annā lahudh dhikrā

rows.translation: He will say: "Alas the woe! Would that I had sent ahead something in my life."
None can punish as He will punish on that day,
And none can bind as He will bind.
O you tranquil soul,
Return to your Lord, well-pleased and well-pleasing Him.
"Enter then among My votaries,
Enter then My garden."
